ExecutableTestSuite.label: Conformance class: Application Schema, Cadastral parcel
ExecutableTestSuite.description:
This test suite examines requirements associated with the application schema.

This is a draft version. It has limitations and is expected to contain errors. Please report any issues or problems in GitHub.

Known limitations are documented in the description of the applicable test case or test assertion. There is a general limitation in all assertions that extensions in additional application schemas are not fully supported.

Source: Conformance Class 'Application schema, Cadastral Parcels'
ExecutableTestSuite.author: PwC

ParameterList.name: ETF Standard Parameters for XML test objects

TestCase.label: Modelling of object references
TestCase.description: Verify whether all instances of the spatial object type CadastralParcel carry as a thematic identifier the attribute nationalCadastralReference. This attribute must enable users to make the link with rights, owners and other cadastral information in national cadastral registers or equivalent.

TestAssertion.label: cp-as.a.1: Verify whether all instances of the spatial object type CadastralParcel carry as a thematic identifier the attribute nationalCadastralReference.
TestAssertion.description:
Verify that all instances of the spatial object type CadastralParcel have as a thematic identifier the attribute nationalCadastralReference.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Annex II Section 6.3.2: Theme-specific Requirements. All instances of the spatial object type CadastralParcel shall carry as a thematic identifier the attribute nationalCadastralReference. This attribute must enable users to make the link with rights, owners and other cadastral information in national cadastral registers or equivalent.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Modelling of object references'

TestAssertion.label: cp-as.a.2: Manual review - Verify that the value of the attribute nationalCadastralReference enables the users to make the link with rights, owners and other cadastral information in national cadastral registers or equivalent.
TestAssertion.description:
Verify that the value of the attribute nationalCadastralReference enables the users to make the link with rights, owners and other cadastral information in national cadastral registers or equivalent.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Annex II Section 6.3.2: Theme-specific Requirements. All instances of the spatial object type CadastralParcel shall carry as a thematic identifier the attribute nationalCadastralReference. This attribute must enable users to make the link with rights, owners and other cadastral information in national cadastral registers or equivalent.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Modelling of object references'

TestCase.label: Cadastral Boundaries
TestCase.description: Verify whether, if cadastral boundaries are provided, the cadastral boundaries corresponding to the outline of a cadastral parcel form closed ring(s).

TestAssertion.label: cp-as.b.1: Cadastral boundaries corresponding to the outline of a cadastral parcel form closed ring(s).
TestAssertion.description:
Check that cadastral boundaries corresponding to the outline of a cadastral parcel form closed ring(s).

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Annex II Section 6.3.2 (2): Theme-specific Requirements. If cadastral boundaries are provided, the cadastral boundaries corresponding to the outline of a cadastral parcel shall form closed ring(s).
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Cadastral Boundaries'

TestCase.label: geometry Representation
TestCase.description: Verification whether the value domain of spatial properties is not restricted to the Simple Feature spatial schema as defined by EN ISO 19125-1.

TestAssertion.label: cp-as.c.1: The value domain of spatial properties is not restricted to the Simple Feature spatial schema as defined by EN ISO 19125-1.
TestAssertion.description:
Check whether all spatial properties only use 0, 1 and 2-dimensional geometric objects that exist in the right 2-, 3- or 4-dimensional coordinate space, and where all curve interpolations respect the rules specified in the reference documents.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Annex II Section x: Theme-specific Requirements. By way of derogation from article 12(1), the value domain of spatial properties used in the xxx package shall not be restricted.
  • IR Requirement Annex II Section 6.3.2: Theme-specific Requirements. By way of derogation from article 12(1), the value domain of spatial properties used in the Cadastral Parcels package shall be restricted to the Simple Feature spatial schema as defined by EN ISO 19125-1:2006.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Geometry Representation'
